headline: Michaels Stores Affected by Tampering
summary: Michaels Stores Inc. said the PIN pads at stores in 20 states were tampered with, potentially exposing customer's credit- and debit-card information. See a list of stores where tampered PIN pads have been detected.

headline: What's News: Business & Finance
summary: What's News: Business & Finance Top Stories for May 12, 2011

headline: Investigators Hopeful on Black Boxes
summary: French crash investigators said they are optimistic about extracting data from the black boxes of an Air France airliner that crashed in the Atlantic Ocean almost two years ago, despite unprecedented challenges in reading the digital recorders.

headline: Qantas Union Calls Off Next Week's Strikes
summary: A union representing more than 1,000 engineers has called off industrial action planned against Qantas for next week, and agreed not to take any more action for at least another four weeks as negotiations resume.

headline: Fund Managers Juiced About Energy Stocks
summary: Energy stocks proved something of a favorite among hedge-fund managers at the SkyBridge Alternatives Conference, known as SALT, amid the downdraft lately in commodities.

headline: Anders Fogh Rasmussen: NATO's Mission, in Libya and Beyond
summary: The Alliance has never been busier, budget constraints notwithstanding.

headline: Michigan Passes New Tax Plan
summary: Michigan's state legislature passed a broad new tax structure ending a raft of tax credits, replacing the state's complex business tax with a flat corporate tax, while imposing a new pension tax and raising income taxes on residents.

headline: Videogame Sales Jump 20%; Sony Lags Competitors
summary: U.S. videogame industry sales jumped 20% in April as a flood of highly anticipated titles hit the market, though sales of Sony's PlayStation 3 rose more slowly in the wake of an attack on its online videogame networks.

headline: Probe Sought on Mexico Torture Allegations
summary: Kay Bailey Hutchison, a Republican senator from Texas, urged Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton to look into torture allegations made by two Americans in a Mexican prison, calling their accusations "very troubling" in a recent letter.

headline: Strassel: A New York Warning for the GOP
summary: Republicans had better get ready to respond to Democratic Mediscare tactics.

headline: White House Unveils Cybersecurity Plan
summary: The White House unveiled a far-reaching cybersecurity plan that largely endorsed the leading proposal on Capitol Hill, boosting the chances Congress will enact a new security regime for companies that run key elements of the nation's infrastructure.

headline: Photos of the Day: May 12
summary: In today's pictures, a table tennis player eyes the ball in the Netherlands, a student is arrested in Chile, workers stand in a crater at Moammar Gadhafi's compound in Libya and more.

headline: Investors Warm Up to Utilities' Debt
summary: Utilities and power generators are back in favor in corporate-bond markets now that public concern about the Japanese nuclear accident is waning and the benefits of a one-time tax break are coming to an end.

headline: Disaster-Readiness Flaws Found at Nuclear Plants
summary: A review of U.S. nuclear safety found equipment that might be needed in an emergency wasn't in working condition at some plants, but regulators said the problems were fixed and didn't pose significant risks.

headline: General Mills Products Going Up in Price
summary: General Mills Inc. said higher prices are materializing for its cereals and its other products on supermarket shelves, a sign that the operating environment is improving.

headline: Bribery Alleged at Postal Service
summary: Federal prosecutors charged five U.S. Postal Service supervisors in Michigan and Ohio with taking bribes in the form of cash, cars, drinks and lap dances in return for steering $13 million worth of vehicle-maintenance work to a private contractor.

headline: Enel Net Profit Rises 14%
summary: Italian utility Enel Thursday said first-quarter net profit rose 14%, above expectations, due to lower financial charges on a reduced debt pile and a smaller tax bill.

headline: Vivendi Net Profit Surges
summary: French conglomerate Vivendi said first-quarter earnings surged even as a recent tax change weighed on telecom operator SFR, and reaffirmed its full-year guidance.

headline: Nigeria Targets Militants In Oil Region
summary: The Nigerian army has launched attacks against militants in the Niger Delta after months of relative quiet in Africa's largest oil-producing region.

headline: Allstate Counts Cost of Tornadoes
summary: Allstate warned investors it had about $1.4 billion in catastrophe losses in April, exceeding in one month its disaster costs for any full quarter since 2008.

headline: CFOs Call for Lower Corporate Tax Rates
summary: CFOs at major multinational corporations urged House lawmakers to lower the corporate tax rate as part of an overhaul, and cited the lack of permanency in tax law as a big concern.

headline: Oil and Gas CEO Pay Beats Other Industries
summary: Chief executives in the oil and gas, telecom, financial and consumer goods sectors were paid more than bosses in other industries in 2010, according to a WSJ/Hay Group survey.

headline: Regulators Defend Financial Revamp Efforts
summary: U.S. financial regulators defended their efforts to make far-reaching changes to rules governing banks and other financial firms, telling senators a repeal of the landmark regulatory revamp could lead to a repeat of the recent financial crisis.

headline: The Galleon Verdict: From Easy Money to Hard Time
summary: Investors are frustrated with lost cases and perceived wrist-slaps for lawlessness on Wall Street. The Rajaratnam case, which exposed the truth about a high-profile trader who made big returns look as easy as falling out of bed could be a turning point.

headline: On Expert Networks, Jury Is Still Out
summary: In the wake of the conviction of Galleon Group found Raj Rajaratnam on insider-trading charges, some observers are predicting a decline in the use of expert networks and others are saying it will just increase vigilance in how they're used.

headline: OCBC Net Falls 7%
summary: Oversea-Chinese Banking Corp., Singapore's second-largest bank by assets, said first-quarter net profit fell 7% on a decline in non-interest income and a rise in staff costs.

headline: Allianz Profit Falls 45%
summary: Allianz, Europe's largest insurer by gross premiums and market capitalization, reported a 45% decline in net profit for the first quarter, mainly reflecting high costs for natural disaster claims, lower realized capital gains and a higher tax rate.

headline: U.K. Industrial Data Disappoint
summary: U.K. industrial production expanded at a slower rate than expected in March as maintenance work on oil and gas fields continued to drag on output, data showed.

headline: Japanese Yields Steady
summary: Japanese government bonds were little changed despite respectable demand in a key 10-year bond action.

headline: Investments Lift San Miguel Net
summary: Philippine conglomerate San Miguel Corp. said first-quarter net profit hit $165.7 million, more than twice the year-earlier $67.3 million, driven by strong performances by new investments and its core food and beverage business.

headline: Elpida Slides to Quarterly Loss
summary: The Japanese maker of DRAM chips reversed into a net loss for the fiscal fourth quarter from January to March .

headline: India Siemens Profit Rises 54%
summary: The Indian unit of German engineering company Siemens posted a better-than-expected 54% increase in its net profit for the fiscal second quarter, driven by strong performances at all its divisions.

headline: Morgan Stanley to Announce Yuan Fund
summary: Morgan Stanley is expected to announce details of a yuan-denominated private equity fund in Hangzhou next week, which it will run in a partnership with Hangzhou Industrial & Commercial Trust Co.

headline: 3i Group Sets New Strategy
summary: 3i Group set out its strategy for the next few years and said it would target a 15% net return across its three distinct business lines.

headline: India's Industrial Output Soars
summary: Robust manufacturing activity drove a 7.3% rise in India's industrial output in March, adding to expectations that the central bank will tighten monetary policy further to control inflation.

headline: Norway Raises Interest Rates
summary: Norway's central bank raised its policy rate for the first time in a year, saying the rate should be increased to stabilize economic activity and inflation in the year ahead.

headline: Glencore Aims 2.5% of IPO to Hong Kong Retail Market
summary: Glencore International aims to raise up to $318 million from the Hong Kong retail portion of its initial public offering, representing 2.5% of the total deal.

headline: India Shares Shrug Off Factory Data
summary: Indian shares dropped in light trade Thursday, as bearish global cues eclipsed a sharper-than-expected increase in factory output for March.

headline: Asia Shares Hit by Commodities Selloff
summary: Asian shares were down as a tumble in energy markets on Wednesday spooked investors. Selling in Sydney was exacerbated by disappointing jobs data, hammering the Australian dollar.

headline: Delay Threatens Hana-KEB Deal
summary: South Korea's Financial Services Commission won't rule on Hana Financial Group's $4.32 billion bid for Lone Star Funds' 51% stake in Korea Exchange Bank next week, which could lead to the collapse of what would be the biggest stake sale in a South Korean bank.

headline: Gulliver's Travails at HSBC
summary: Anyone expecting radical thinking from the U.K. bank likely came away disappointed after its Investor Day.

headline: Hooray
summary: As with most real estate, sometimes what makes a bar stand out is location, location, location. And that's what Hooray, a massive, al fresco bar and restaurant on the waterfront in Causeway Bay, has going for it. Unfortunately, that may be the only thing going for it.

headline: Hindusthan Buys German Glass Maker
summary: Hindusthan National Glass & Industries has said it will buy the assets of Germany's ailing glass-container maker Agenda Glas AG for about $71 million.

headline: Two Spain Quakes Cause Major Damage
summary: Two earthquakes struck southeast Spain in quick succession Wednesday, killing at least ten people and causing major damage to buildings.

headline: Anish Kapoor's Leviathan
summary: Anish Kapoor dedicated Leviathan, his biggest-ever installation, to Ai Weiwei, the Chinese dissident artist who was detained by Chinese authorities last month. Some photos from the show.

headline: Hyundai launches Fluidic Verna
summary: Hyundai Motor launched the new Fluidic Verna model in New Delhi on Wednesday. Some snapshots.

headline: Turkey Targets Bank as Economy Boils
summary: Turkey demanded that one of its biggest commercial banks, Akbank, pay an extra $742 million in reserve requirements, hitting the bank's profits as the government and central bank struggle to control worrying signs of overheating in the economy.

headline: ECB Forecasters Raise Inflation Estimates
summary: Forecasters for the European Central Bank have significantly raised their estimates of inflation in the euro zone for this year, and now see consumer-price inflation well above the ECB's threshold of 2%.

headline: More Foreign Investments Allowed
summary: The cabinet committee on economic affairs approved foreign-direct investment in limited liability partnerships, but with some riders.

headline: Union Cancels Friday's Qantas Strike
summary: A one-hour strike planned for Friday by more than 1,000 engineers against Qantas Airways has been cancelled, but the union said similar work stoppages planned for next week are still on.

headline: RWE Profit Rises but Wary of Nuclear Tax
summary: German utility RWE said that first-quarter operating profit fell less than expected as earnings improvements at its U.K. unit and an oil price-driven increase at its oil and gas production business helped to offset the poor performance of its trading and gas wholesale operations.

headline: MakeMyTrip Buys Stake in Singapore Travel Agency
summary: MakeMyTrip, the online travel service, acquired a majority stake in Luxury Tours and Travel, a Singapore-based travel agency this week.

headline: Record Labels, LimeWire, Hold Settlement Talks
summary: Lawyers for several major record labels have held at least three settlement conferences with representatives of a file-sharing service that they sued for copyright infringement, according to a federal court docket entry.

headline: Free and Unionized Aren't Always Equal
summary: In his brief review of "A Covert Life," Ted Morgan's 1999 biography of Jay Lovestone (1897-1990), Arch Puddington writes that, "Lovestone never wavered in his belief that unions free of state control are essential to democratic societies."

headline: Crowd-Funding Sites Prepare for a Boom
summary: With regulators considering easing fund-raising rules for fast-growth start-ups, the social-networking sites that link entrepreneurs to large pools of investors are gearing up for a boom.

headline: Lost in Space
summary: None

headline: Google Plans to Challenge Swiss Ruling on Mapping
summary: Google threatened to pull its Street View application from Switzerland if the country's highest court doesn't overturn an a ruling that would force the company to blur out every face that appears on the service.

headline: The Classical Cavalier
summary: As he prepares for American Ballet Theatre's spring season in New York, Cory Stearns reflects on his road to becoming the company's newest principal dancer.

headline: Singer Postcard Ads
summary: See Singer sewing machine postcard advertisements from around the world, dating from the turn of the century.

headline: Rifts Emerge Among San Jose's Unions
summary: A push by San Jose officials to cut labor costs as they try to close a $115 million budget gap is exposing unusual tensions among the city's municipal unions.

headline: Post-Recession, the Rich Are Different
summary: Bentleys and Herm√®s bags are selling again. Yet the wealthiest Americans are emerging from the downturn as different consumers than they were.

headline: DuPont to Add Titanium-Dioxide Plant
summary: DuPont said it plans to to start a new titanium-dioxide plant in 2015 as a global shortage of the pigment pushes up prices.

headline: Rosen and Hanemann: America Gains From Chinese Investment
summary: These companies, like the Japanese before, are creating jobs and growth in the U.S.

headline: Dollar Jumps on Euro
summary: The long-beleaguered dollar surged as a commodities selloff and euro-zone debt woes stirred waves of risk aversion. The euro lost two cents versus the dollar.

headline: Armed With Stone-Tipped Arrows, Hunters Stalk Their Inner Cave Men
summary: There's a backwards movement afoot in the U.S. hunting world: primitive types are eschewing high-powered guns and precision weapons in favor of more primitive, handmade gear.

headline: Life at the Top
summary: Penthouse apartments in Hong Kong, while covetable for their outdoor space, often come with a hitch: Because of how mortgages are calculated, they can be hard to sell. This 2,280-square-foot duplex in the Mid-Levels has been on the market for a year. It comes with a 929-square-foot roof garden, and is on sale for 63 million Hong Kong dollars (US$8.1 million).
